009package imagingbook.common.color.iterate;
010
011import java.awt.Color;
012
013import imagingbook.common.color.sets.ColorEnumeration;
014
015/**
016 * <p>
017 * This class defines methods for iterating over an ordered set of AWT colors.
018 * The color set can be constructed from individual AWT colors 
019 * (see {@link #FiniteLinearColorSequencer(Color...)})
020 * or an enum class implementing
021 * {@link ColorEnumeration} (see {@link #FiniteLinearColorSequencer(Class)}).
022 * </p>
023 * <p>
024 * Usage examples:
025 * </p>
026 * <pre>
027 * // from individual colors (or array of colors):
028 * ColorSequencer iter1 = new FiniteLinearColorSequencer(Color.blue, Color.green, Color.red);
029 * for (int i = 0; i &lt; 10; i++) {
030 *      Color c = iter1.next();
031 *      // use color c
032 * }
033 * 
034 * // from enum type:
035 * FiniteLinearColorSequencer iter2 = new FiniteLinearColorSequencer(BasicAwtColor.class);
036 * iter2.reset(5);
037 * for (int i = 0; i &lt; 10; i++) {
038 *      Color c = iter2.nextRandom();
039 *      // use color c
040 * }
041 * </pre>
042 * 
043 * @author WB
044 * @version 2022/04/06
045 * 
046 * @see Color
047 */
048public class FiniteLinearColorSequencer implements ColorSequencer {
049
050        protected final Color[] colorArray;
051        protected int next = 0;
052
053        public FiniteLinearColorSequencer(Color... colors) {
054                if (colors.length == 0) {
055                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("color set may not be empty!");
056                }
057                this.colorArray = colors.clone();
058        }
059
060        public FiniteLinearColorSequencer(Class<? extends ColorEnumeration> clazz) {
061//              this.colorArray = ColorEnumeration.getColors(clazz);
062                this(ColorEnumeration.getColors(clazz));
063        }
064        
065        // -------------------------------------------------------
066
067        public int size() {
068                return colorArray.length;
069        }
070
071        public Color getColor(int idx) {
072                return colorArray[idx];
073        }
074
075        public Color[] getColors() {
076                return colorArray;
077        }
078
079        // --- iteration stuff -----------------------------------
080
081        /**
082         * Reset the iterator, such that the color returned by the following call to
083         * {@link #next()} has index 0.
084         */
085        public void reset() {
086                reset(0);
087        }
088
089        /**
090         * Reset the iterator such that the index of the item returned by the following
091         * call to {@link #next()} has the specified start index.
092         * 
093         * @param offset the new start index
094         */
095        public void reset(int offset) {
096                this.next = Math.floorMod(offset, colorArray.length);
097        }
098
099        @Override
100        public Color next() {
101                Color nc = colorArray[next];
102                next = (next + 1) % colorArray.length;
103                return nc;
104        }
105
106}
